caption: Table 1: Agent performance in WebArena. Δ: relative performance gains from policy optimization.
description: Table 1 presents the success rates of various web agents on the WebArena benchmark, comparing their performance with and without policy optimization using world models.

caption: Table 2: Domain-specific performance of agents using GPT-40-mini as policy models
description: Table 2 presents a breakdown of the domain-specific performance of agents using GPT-40-mini as policy models, showing the success rates for each domain and the overall improvement achieved by the WMA web agent compared to the vanilla CoT method.

caption: Table 3: Success rate on Mind2Web tests using GPT-3.5-Turbo as policy models. EA = element accuracy; EF = element filtering; AF₁ = action F₁; * = results from the original paper.
description: Table 3 presents the success rates of different methods on the Mind2Web benchmark, comparing element accuracy, action accuracy, step success rate, and overall success rate.

caption: Table 4: Head-to-head comparison of Tree search agent (results are from Koh et al. (2024)) and ours regarding (i) SR and (ii) API cost, and (iii) inference time. We use GPT-40 for policy models.
description: Table 4 compares the performance of the proposed WMA web agent and the Tree search agent in terms of success rate, API cost, and inference time on the WebArena benchmark.

caption: Table 5: Results of the ablation study in WebArena.
description: Table 5 presents the results of an ablation study conducted in the WebArena environment, evaluating the impact of different components of the proposed World-Model-Augmented (WMA) web agent on its overall success rate.

caption: Table 6: Performance with different value models.
description: This table compares the success rate of web agents using different value functions (a fine-tuned LLM vs. GPT-40-mini) for policy optimization.

caption: Table 7: Results of applying self-refine to GPT-40-mini using simulated environment feedback.
description: The table presents the success rate (SR) achieved by vanilla CoT and two variations of the proposed WMA web agent (with and without self-refinement) in the Map domain of the WebArena benchmark.
